title: RuPaul's Drag Race UK episode 1 review - more fabulousness and less filth, please
text:
“People of the United Kingdom, your queen has arrived.” Except this wasn’t a 5ft 3in nonagenarian walking her corgis but drag legend RuPaul, a 6ft 4in platinum blonde New Yorker flanked by hunks in bearskin hats and Union Jack Y-fronts.

Sporting false eyelashes, day-glo frocks and vertiginous heels, RuPaul’s Drag Race UK (BBC Three) finally tottered into the BBC. Against all odds, the drag talent search has become a global phenomenon over the past decade - a cult hit exported to 193 countries and winning a walk-in wardrobe full of Emmys.

Now we have our own edition at last, seeking a UK drag star with “charisma, uniqueness, nerve and talent”. Don’t think too hard about what that spells. Catfighting...
description: “People of the United Kingdom, your queen has arrived.
